meanings.definition: The quality or state of being generic.
meanings.sent1: The genericnesses of the store-brand products made them affordable for everyone.
meanings.sent2: The genericnesses of the white packaging made it hard to distinguish one product from another.
meanings.sent3: The party theme was 'celebrating genericnesses,' where everyone dressed in plain white shirts and jeans.
meanings.sent4: In a world full of unique flowers, the field of daisies stood out with their genericnesses.
meanings.sent5: The genericnesses of the music made it easy to listen to without getting bored.

meanings.definition: The characteristic of lacking distinctiveness or individuality.
meanings.sent1: The genericnesses of the office building made it blend in with the rest of the city skyline.
meanings.sent2: Her outfit's genericnesses made it hard to spot her in the crowd.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's sidekick joked about his genericnesses, saying he was like a plain white crayon in a box of colors.
meanings.sent4: The artist's painting stood out among the genericnesses of the gallery, drawing attention with its vibrant colors.
meanings.sent5: The genericnesses of the town's architecture made it feel like every street looked the same.
